KA.AQWE.content: Enlightenment (Aufklärung) is man’s exit (Ausgang) from his self-incurred minority (Unmündigkeit), freed from alien guidance (fremder Leitung) > but it is so comfortable to a minor: pay others to do the job for me, guardians will take care of knowledge > the “fair sex” has always found it difficult to become enlightened [laziness, comfort, misogyny?]
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: Enlightenment (Aufklärung) is man’s exit (Ausgang) from his self-incurred minority (Unmündigkeit), freed from alien guidance (fremder Leitung) > but it is so comfortable to a minor: pay others to do the job for me, guardians will take care of knowledge > the “fair sex” has always found it difficult to become enlightened [laziness, comfort, misogyny?]

KA.AQWE.content: escape by their own cultivation of the mind (eigene Bearbeitung ihres Geistes) > prejudices will come back to haunt those who plant them (i.e. the guardians)
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: escape by their own cultivation of the mind (eigene Bearbeitung ihres Geistes) > prejudices will come back to haunt those who plant them (i.e. the guardians)

KA.AQWE.content: will a law bring enlightenment? > PUBLIC vs. PRIVATE: private is where an official obeys a law and does not apply reason > thoughts against a law do not disrupt the law, one is still dutiful
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: will a law bring enlightenment? > PUBLIC vs. PRIVATE: private is where an official obeys a law and does not apply reason > thoughts against a law do not disrupt the law, one is still dutiful

KA.IUHCI.content: history tells the phenomenal appearances of the will (determined by laws of nature) > man unintentionally promotes an end of nature unknown to him (in his own inclinations)
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: history tells the phenomenal appearances of the will (determined by laws of nature) > man unintentionally promotes an end of nature unknown to him (in his own inclinations)

KA.IUHCI.content: philosophers must presume man’s own purpose (Absicht), so it is up to the philosopher to discover an end of nature in senseless march of human events > Kant will become the scientist of human history [?]
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: philosophers must presume man’s own purpose (Absicht), so it is up to the philosopher to discover an end of nature in senseless march of human events > Kant will become the scientist of human history [?]

KA.IUHCI.content: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

KA.IUHCI.content: highest master should be just in himself and yet a man, right conceptions, great experience, good will > a complete solution is impossible [regulative idea?]
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: highest master should be just in himself and yet a man, right conceptions, great experience, good will > a complete solution is impossible [regulative idea?]

KA.IUHCI.content: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring new relations about states and to form new bodies (break up the old)
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring new relations about states and to form new bodies (break up the old)

KA.IUHCI.content: a state, through laws, can maintain itself automatically [?] > if one presumes all these events will result in nothing, that the species is just preparing us for a hell of evils
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: a state, through laws, can maintain itself automatically [?] > if one presumes all these events will result in nothing, that the species is just preparing us for a hell of evils

KA.IUHCI.content: COSMOPOLITAN STATE > if States just want their own expansion, this will hinder expansion of citizens’ minds
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: COSMOPOLITAN STATE > if States just want their own expansion, this will hinder expansion of citizens’ minds

KA.EP.content: letting troops out to another state: subjects used and consumed like things to be handled at will: army as machine > POWER OF MONEY (most reliable instrument of war), fund for army = standing army
KA.EP.linkedContent: letting troops out to another state: subjects used and consumed like things to be handled at will: army as machine > POWER OF MONEY (most reliable instrument of war), fund for army = standing army

KA.EP.content: democracy refers to who can hold the highest power > republic refers to method by which people are governed (republicanism: principle acc. which executive power separated from legislative power) > autocracy, aristocracy,  or democracy…. republican or despotic
KA.EP.linkedContent: democracy refers to who can hold the highest power > republic refers to method by which people are governed (republicanism: principle acc. which executive power separated from legislative power) > autocracy, aristocracy, or democracy…. republican or despotic

KA.EP.content: law as mutual impeding of evil private attitudes > nature wants that law achieve superior force > federation better than universal monarchy: desire of every ruler total permanent power
KA.EP.linkedContent: law as mutual impeding of evil private attitudes > nature wants that law achieve superior force > federation better than universal monarchy: desire of every ruler total permanent power

KA.EP.content: nature keeps man apart w/ language & religion > spirit of commerce, POWER OF MONEY, prevents war > certainty of eternal peace makes it one’s duty to work toward this state [but? p. 454]
KA.EP.linkedContent: nature keeps man apart w/ language & religion > spirit of commerce, POWER OF MONEY, prevents war > certainty of eternal peace makes it one’s duty to work toward this state [but? p. 454]

KA.EP.content: [wearing out university’s shoes] possession of power corrupts the free judgment of reason inevitably
KA.EP.linkedContent: [wearing out university’s shoes] possession of power corrupts the free judgment of reason inevitably

KA.EP.content: uniting cause to bring about a common will
